reviewText: I've been practicing yoga with videos for some time now, and I thought that this would be a relaxing workout which would help with my frequent headaches. However, I discovered that the video is more focused towards bodily aches and pains--namely neck pain, back pain, arthritis, or injuries. For someone suffering from one of those conditions and who has only a limited range of motion, this DVD could be very useful. It is a led my a husband and wife team, Charles and Lisa Matkin, and broken into three 10 minutes sections. The first, in which Lisa demostrates and Charles provides voiceover, is a series of seated poses on a chair with a strong emphasis on breathing. Charles leads the second section with Lisa's voiceover; this section includes gentle standing postures using the chair for assistance. In the final section, Lisa again leads, this time demonstrating a series of floor poses for relaxation. Anyone who has some prior experience with yoga is likely to find these practices to be much too easy, but for those who are absolute beginners and/or those who have chronic pain, this DVD could be beneficial.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a runner and am recovering from upper body surgery. My surgeon recommended practicing Yoga to assist with my recovery, as well as ingrain good posture into my healing.I have used many Yoga DVDs over the years, and I found this one to be just what I needed as I recover.The first two minutes are a brief introduction to the instructors and their philosophy. The setting of the DVD is an outdoor pool with an adjoining small spa. There is a great deal of blue and green in the background.From two minutes to fourteen minutes is the first section of the practice. This first section uses a chair to teach breathing techniques and do some modified twists and easy poses. You will be bringing your arms up overhead, as you are able to. You will do a sitting dog and cat stretch, flexing and bending your spine.At fourteen minutes, the second section starts, continuously from the first. There are no breaks or sections between segments. In this segment, you stand and do poses assisted by the chair. You will learn how to ground yourself for the mountain pose and how to stretch into modified lunges. There is more mind connection emphasized in this segment, the overdubbed instructions ask you to focus your awareness on where the pain is in your body, and also to check in with your emotions and try to release them.Just before the 24 minute mark the final segment starts. In this segment we do lying twists, ending with a focused relaxation exercise. Again, the mind-body connection is brought into play. If you are open to their suggestions, this may be the most powerful aspect of the DVD for you.The music is unobtrusive and light. The instructors change, with Lisa demonstrating segments one and three while Charles narrates and then Charles demonstrates segment two while Lisa narrates.This is not a high-energy, high-octane fat-burner. This workout is for recovering from illness or physical trauma, or coping with daily chronic bodily pain. A keeper for those who deal with chronic problems.
summary: For Recovery from Sugery and Chronic Bodily Pain
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Desert Gypsy "A Brooklyn Girl Out West"
reviewText: I have severe arthritis and I bought this dvd because on a good day I'd prefer to go for a walk or try something outdoors but on a bad day I'd still like to accomplish something physical while indoors. Maybe I am more limited than most but I have not once ever made it through the end of a session on this dvd. I can get through all or at least most of programs like PBS's Sit and Be Fit but these instructors move a little too fast for me and into poses that hurt or I'd have to modify every move.Everyone is different and I'm sure this program works for someone but it would be helpful since there are two teachers if they would demonstrate in tandem a way for even the most achy-and-pained to participate, or possibly add a small section geared specifically for those "bad days".
summary: not the best for my "bad days"
Title: N/A

reviewText: Based on the amazon review of this DVD, I had no high expectations. Yet, being an advanced beginner with an exclusively home-based practice, I have watched/tried hundreds of yoga DVD and can say, this is one of a kind. Its exceedingly gentle without being geriatric. The couple who tag teams on this approx 1/2 hr practice, is one I grew to admire through practice with Yoga Zone - Alan Finger's protege's. The narration is unique in that it includes not only pointers on the poses to keep them safe to chronic pain sufferers, but also contain phrases such as 'uncoil that which holds you' etc. I will use this when I am feeling under the weather and am not up to a normal yoga routine, but still need to experience the healing benefits of yoga. I will also give it to a family member who hasn't worked out in years and has back issues. I can truly trust it to be safe for that newbie.....I can't say that about any other yoga DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very good DVD for people who are not advanced practitioners of yoga. It's a slow easy pace and helps with lower back pain.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Are they serious?  This was a ridiculous 'yoga' video.  Who are these people?  I am so tired of 'yoga teachers' (and I use that term loosely for these two) who have nothing creative to offer.  This DVD was a waste of time and money. The movements were ridiculously simple and offered no real stretch or benefit to the body. Don't bother with it unless you want to waste your time and money too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I suffer from morning stiffness in the neck & shoulders, as well as scoliosis, & have purchased many yoga tapes.  For me, Healing Yoga For Aches & Pains DVD is great!  The production quality is wonderful, filmed outdoors.  I found the narration & background music very restful, & all the poses were achievable.  You don't need a special chair or mat to follow along.  As someone over 50, this DVD helps me start my day feeling better.  I am ordering their other tape as well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Since I started using this DVD I can't tell you how much better I'm feeling, It's something that just about anyone can do, I hope in time that I can move on to harder programs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My husband and I use this video to eliminate sore muscles and back pain after running.  There are no strenuous poses- slow movements that really do soothe your body.  We really love this instruction video.
